intro: Malesherbia lirana var. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers range in color from white to pink. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its beauty and ease of care.
